block.p: Dr. Jane Chang, a daughter of Lina Chang and Dr. Tai Hwan Chang of Locust Valley, N.Y., was married last evening to Jeffrey Thomas Kvaal, a son of Martha and Robert Kvaal of Lexington, Mass. The Rev. Laurie Ann McNeill performed the ceremony at the Glenwood Presbyterian Church in Glenwood Landing, N.Y.
The couple graduated from Brown University.

Dr. Jane Chang, a daughter of Lina Chang and Dr. Tai Hwan Chang of Locust Valley, N.Y., was married last evening to Jeffrey Thomas Kvaal, a son of Martha and Robert Kvaal of Lexington, Mass. The Rev. Laurie Ann McNeill performed the ceremony at the Glenwood Presbyterian Church in Glenwood Landing, N.Y.
The couple graduated from Brown University.

Dr. Chang, 27, is keeping her name. She received her medical degree from the University of Vermont and is a pediatric intern at the Columbia-Presbyterian Center of New York Presbyterian Hospital. Her father retired as an anesthesiologist at North Shore University Hospital at Glen Cove, N.Y.

Mr. Kvaal, 28, received an M.B.A. from Columbia University and is a research associate investigating wireless equipment stocks at Lehman Brothers in New York. His mother retired as a director of program evaluation in Boston for the United States Health and Human Services Department. His father is a senior vice president and the chief financial officer of the Prospero Technologies Corporation, a provider of interactive services for the Internet, in Cambridge, Mass.
